task.title: Provide ECOM registry information for a PSY
task.shortdesc: This section describes how to package the PSY as an ECOM plug-in that can be loaded by the LBS subsystem.

context.p: A PSY must provide the ECOM registry with information about itself. Registry information is used by the Location Framework to recognise a PSY implementation. This section describes how to create ECOM registry information for a PSY.

step.info: Obtain two UIDs for the PSY from Symbian.

substep.info: A PSY DLL UID is required for the DLL that packages the PSY.
A PSY implementation UID is required to identify the implementation of the PSY interface that is loaded by ECOM.

step.info: Create an ECOM resource file for the PSY.
ECOM Registry information is stored in a resource file. The resource file must define a REGISTRY_INFO resource at the start of the file. The resource file must not contain anything else.
The REGISTRY_INFO structure and some useful constant declarations are defined in registryinfo.rh.
The registry information consists of the following:

substep.info: A display name for the PSY (this can be shown in a UI).

The display name in the ECOM registration file cannot be localised. In order to provide a PSY name that can be localised, the PSY needs to create a separate localised resource file. The path to this localised resource file must be specified through the Positioning Plug-in Information API.
If the localised resource file is not specified or cannot be found, the display name in the ECOM registry resource file is used.

step.info: An example resource file is shown below. Note that the inteface_uid must be 0x101F7A7C as specified in this file. The dll_uid and implementation_uid will be different in your implementation.

postreq.p: Define PSY attributes using the Positioning Plug-in Information API.
Test the PSY using the PSY tester application.
